review.reviewBody: I really liked this product. The fit is perfect. The weight is a very nice midweight, as described. Got it for a great price too. I've only worn it a couple times and a seam is starting to separate by the ribcage area (so not a high stress area). Very disappointed. Losing faith in Mountain Hardwear. I have ended up returning most of what I have purchased from them lately.
review.name: Loved it but the quality turned out to be poor.
comment:
Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. I am very sorry to hear that the Summit Grid has not met your expectations. We pride ourselves on producing bomber gear, and we love this particular piece, so we’re surprised to hear about your experience. Please give our Warranty team a call. We’d love to get detail from you and help make it right. 

Warranty Phone: M-F 9:00am-12pm & 1pm-4pm PT; (800) 953-8398

review.reviewBody: Comfortable. Doesn't stink too quick like most polyester.
review.name: I have the hooded version and this half zip. Like them. Slightly boxy cut.

review.reviewBody:
I got the Large (male, age 29, 6’2”, 225lbs, 38 wst and 44 hip) and have worked in the outdoor industry 10 years and finally found the perfect hiking fleece. The hoodie gets all the love, but I wanted a mid layer for wearing under a shell hiking that also serves as a clean looking town-day outer layer. I also usually wear a beanie so don’t need the hood.
Sizing: the models they chose for photos make this fleece look rather billowy around the bottom, but for my body type (half athletic, half dad-bod), it drapes perfectly, has no extra space at the hips for warmth to escape, fits and feels like an extremely comfy, tailored sweater and the sleeves are the perfect length. The R1 seems to be the standard of comparison for this style of fleece, but I don’t enjoy the slim fit and I found the internal fleece backing to be too itchy for my arms, and it’s a pain to peel on and off if you’re wearing a shirt underneath. This sweater has no such problems, the fleece is less clingy and moves much more freely combined with other layers.
Color: I got the copper clay and love it, looks somewhere between a dusty orange and coyote brown (pictures are true to color), a subtle pop of color next to my usual hiking trip grays and greens. 
Weight: mine weighs in at 11oz on my kitchen scale, will definitely make the line-up for my JMT hike next year.
All in all, it’s light, breathable, not too technical looking, and COMFORTABLE. And at 2/3rd the price of the competition, it’s a no-brainer guys.
review.name: Ticks all my boxes

review.reviewBody: Very happy with these half zips. Bought a bunch. Tried other brands and went with these.
review.name: Good Fit - True Large

review.reviewBody: Mens Summit Grid Half Zip fits good, bright for hiking, is comfortable and light.
review.name: Mens Summit Grid Half Zip

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Quilted Knit Cuff Mitten - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased the gray mittens and they are just as advertised - warm and waterproof.  The snow has yet to soak through even though the outside of the mittens have been sopping wet.     The fleece is nice and soft and unlike other reviewers, it does not cause my hands to overheat or sweat.
review.name: Good mittens

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Quilted Knit Cuff Mitten - Women's
review.reviewBody: Exact same color I requested! I liked them so much I bought a pair for my sister and two pairs of the gloves!

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Quilted Knit Cuff Mitten - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these mittens and they keep my hands very warm. However, because they are waterproof and warm, your hands will sweat. It takes 5-7 days to get the inside to dry if sitting on a heat vent. After a while, they start to smell. The only cleaning recommended is spot cleaning. Agent does not recommend putting in washer or drier. Very dissatisfied as they essentially become in usable after several earrings due to the moisture in the inside.
review.name: Mittens start to smell.

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Quilted Knit Cuff Mitten - Women's
review.reviewBody: I like them.  They hold my hand warmers and keep my whole hand warm.  I am using rechargeable warmers and they with mittens are great.
review.name: Warm, warmer, warmest

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Quilted Knit Cuff Mitten - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very soft inside, easy to do work outside because the mittens are very flexible and warm!

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Quilted Knit Cuff Mitten - Women's
review.reviewBody: Was very happy with the size  & fit… NEED to wear glove liners with them

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Quilted Knit Cuff Mitten - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are definitely very warm mittens, which is what I was looking for. Glad I was able to get the smallest size (I’m a female with small hands) in the pretty cranberry color. They’re a good fit. My only complaint is that these are not machine washable at all, only spot clean. But I have no complaints with the quality, fit, comfort and warmth. So glad I decided to give them a try.
review.name: Quilts Mitt is Great!

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Quilted Knit Cuff Mitten - Women's
review.reviewBody: Had them for a week and the lines insides didn’t match up anymore!!

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Quilted Knit Cuff Mitten - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wore them once for about an hour shoveling snow. I bought a large, I have long fingers and like my mittens to be roomy. They were great, no complaints. Kept my hands very warm and dry. Until, I went to put them in again and the seam was coming apart at the side. I called customer service, my first option was to send them back for repair, which could take up to a month. My second option was to return them and reorder. They didn’t have the color I wanted but I settled anyway. They could offer my a small percentage off or partial expedited shipping. The rep could have cared less. Put me on hold a dozen times and ultimately after the 4th hold for several minutes, I hung up. Returned to the store and will not buy another product again. Sales reps are just so rude, I felt I was bothering them. Anyway, overall I don’t recommend due to the lack of longevity.
review.name: Unfortunately no good

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Quilted Knit Cuff Mitten - Women's
review.reviewBody: These mittens are hard to get on, even though they are not too small, once I get them on.  I thought they would be warmer, after reading other reviews, but my hands never warm up during a 45 min. walk (note: temps are usually 30-45 deg., not too cold).  And, the thumb is especially cold. Last, the color is no where near what it looked like in the picture - it is red!
review.name: ok, not real pleased, compared to what other reviews said

name: WP Insulated Quilted Knit Cuff Mitten - Women's

I loved Adidas shoes, especially when they are on special sales. I've bought quite a lot and keep them.
However, the Five Ten Freerider shoes are way below my expectations. They are rough, thinly supported and apparent low quality. 
They are not worth at the sale price, let alone at the original price which is more than double. Unfortunately, I have to return them.

review.reviewBody: I have owned several pairs of these shoes for mountain biking. I absolutely love them so I bought my boyfriend his first pair. I told him they really help you stick to the pedals and they're nice and stiff so that your feet don't get tired. he didn't believe if she could make that big a difference, but he was pleasantly surprised and really likes them too.
review.name: I love these shoes for mountain biking

Buy the Specialized Roubaix Armadillo Elite Clincher Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Roubaix Armadillo Elite Clincher Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Roubaix Armadillo Elite Clincher Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I got these from competitive cyclist for my New Caledonia 5. Had them mounted (tubed) on a set of Reynolds AR41 wheels. 
First impression&nice tire, comfortable feel, great handling and predictability. The 25's measure in at 28mm. 
700 miles in& not particularly puncture resistant. Multiple flats in the first 700 miles on chip seal roads, no severe debris. 
INCREDIBLY difficult to mount and remove. So much so that, for me, they really aren't a good choice in the real world. 
My initial thought on the difficult mount was just to run them tubeless with sealant. But even tubeless and sealant can leave you with a flat and if you can't get the tire back on the rim, you're walking home. 
Bottom line&I'm dumping them.
review.name: Almost Great

name: Roubaix Armadillo Elite Clincher Tire

review.reviewBody: Love this hat!! It's the perfect fit and I love the chill color with my dark brown hair!!
review.name: Great all around hat!!

review.reviewBody: I love it! Been using the new one a lot because of the color (black) very easy to pair with mostly anything. Have an older orange and purple. Recently got another one too (asphalt)
review.name: Comfy hat

review.reviewBody: The old model had the option of a L/XL size. It was the best hat on the market. The new model doesn't fit right and looks bad. I am a guy with a normal head. Don't buy.
review.name: New sizing is uncomfortable and looks bad

review.reviewBody: This Horizon Hat is perfect! My husband bought one years ago and it has been his go to hat. It is so cool on his head in the summer heat. It's literally held together with threads from wearing it constantly and washing it and he has not been able to find another. I found it for him and it will be a big surprise on his birthday! I bought two and am very pleased with them!
review.name: This hat is a must have!

review.reviewBody: Great quality and fit, would love to get anither color.
review.name: Great hat

review.reviewBody: This was my go to hat for years until you did away with the L/XL size.
review.name: Bring Back The L/XL Size

review.reviewBody: I travel a lot and try on probably 25 baseball caps a month from all kinds of places and venues and almost never buy any. I probably am only able to purchase 1 out of 250 hats that I try on because most have a poorly made brim that irritates my forehead. The Horizon Hat was one I quickly tried on in the store and it felt great right away and kept on at home for 8 hours working at my computer no problem--almost did not realize that I had it on at times. NF achieves this great fit by sewing in a very soft liner in the brim that says "The North Face." The only issue I saw was that after 8 hours--I had a indentation tattoo on my forehead that said THE NORTH FACE that went away a few hours later. But it's still a keeper. Now as far as appearance--it's OK looking--there are better looking caps--but it is better to feel good than to look good. What good is a great looking cap that digs into your forehead? If you have the same problem as me finding a comfortable cap to wear all day--try this one--I would be surprised if it did not work out for you. PS: The salesman at the North Face store also had a Horizon Hat on I saw at checkout--he says it's his favorite cap he wears all day when I asked him if it comfortable.
review.name: Great Impulse Buy--Very Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: The previous style as mentioned by so many reviewers was perfect. TNF needs to go back to that style of S/M and L/XL
review.name: GO back to the old sizing

review.reviewBody: I have the hat in two colors, the last order never arrived, terrible costumes service!
review.name: I would not buy the product again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this hat, its the only one that fits me just right. Its also very breathable which is great for warm weather.
review.name: My favorite hat

name: Horizon Hat

hasVariant.name: Verte 18L Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Verte 18L Pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It’s basically everything it says it is. Well thought out. Side country and resort? Yea! Not enough for day in the backcountry. Also cool that it can carry snowshoes or a board. Beware the sizing, them small/medium felt too small for my 19in back, despite that being the upper limit on sizing.
review.name: Awesome backpack for resort+

review.reviewBody: Stylish and comfortable, this pack is perfect for days lapping in the resort. Not to be confined to chairs, this pack has a well designed avy pocket that shins in the slack country, and can even work well for light/fast backcountry missions. The two big drawbacks are the lack of a google and internal stash pockets.
review.name: Well designed frontside ski pack

review.reviewBody: The Gregory Verte 18 is the perfect size pack for playful in bounds ski days or short trips in the backcountry.  The pockets and organizational structure keeps all my gear where it needs to be and fits well to my body.  The elastic hip belt is a dream come true and adjusts to my various amount of layers and dynamic movements while skiing. Add on an insulated hydration sleeve for your bladder and hose and this pack has all the essentials for a fun ski day.
review.name: Great size and fit

review.reviewBody: Really impressed by this backpack!! It's hard for me to want to ski with a backpack but I oftentimes have gopros in the pockets along with snacks and wish I could store some water or a layer. The Verte 18L was perfect for that! Fit all of my basic items as well as the side zip for my phone because my current bib pocket is positioned on my rib cage and it jams my phone into my ribs when I bend over to buckle my boots or take a big compression on a bump.  This 18L pack fit really well, contoured to my body, was flexible but supportive.  I like the padded shoulder straps and love the elastic hipbelt!!! Huge improvement over other packs on the market without elasticity in the hipbelt. Also oversized buckles for it were easy to work with. Would absolutely recommend this bag for anyone skiing resorts that doesn't want a bag that is overkill / bulky for the day but wants performance, a great fit, and good style!
review.name: Perfect fit for a day at the resort

name: Verte 18L Pack

description: Buy the Katadyn BeFree 1L Tactical Microfilter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: BeFree 1L Tactical Microfilter
hasVariant.description: Buy the Katadyn BeFree 1L Tactical Microfilter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Carried this with me out elk hunting this year and it was very handy to have. Didn't have to carry a ton of water just filled up every time i crossed a creek. Love it
review.name: Handy

review.reviewBody: Broke this in while summiting The Grand Teton and it was a major hit and kept me hydrated up and down.

This is an all around great filter.  I have been using Katadyn filters for a number of years and have never been disappointed. I use them all year round here in the mountains of NH. Works great even in below zero temps during winter mountaineering trips. The best advice is to pre-soak the filter before heading out on your trip. This will help the water go thru the filter easier. 
Mark
review.name: Great filter!

review.reviewBody: First of all, this is an excellent water filter. The BeFree is the best on the market in my opinion. It has a great flow through the filter and the bag is easy to fill in a stream vs plastic ones. The best part is you don't need to backflush but instead just rinse the entire filter under water or in the bag. I purchased the black version but don't understand what makes this one more expensive - just the aesthetic? You can' go wrong, but just note the price difference.
review.name: Great Filter - Why is Black More Expensive?

review.reviewBody:
This is a game changer!  An instant staple of my camping/hiking/travel kit.  Packable down to  almost nothing while capable of holding 1 liter of water.  The filter is effective, quick working, and simple.  I use it to filter and fill up my other water bottles while camping.  I ran very silty water through it on my last hike and the water came out 100% clear, instantly.

Again, I can’t emphasize enough, this is one of the things that will automatically get thrown into my backpack for every future trip.
review.name: My new go-to water filtration option

review.reviewBody: Excellent water filter to have on long or short hikes.

My go to water filter for every outdoor activity. The collapsible bottle stores easily and takes up very little room. Love that I can drink straight from the bottle or squeeze it into another container. The wide mouth makes it much easier to collect water over the Sawyer micro squeeze. I prefer the black version as it feels a little more durable over the regular version
Great for backpacking as it takes up very little space and is extremely light. Used it this weekend, filtered three bottles of lake water for my trip. Glad I bought it!

The flow rate was exceptional and the price is hard to beat. In consideration the cost of filters on the grayl as well as the frequency of changing topped with overall weight; the befree just overshadowed it and really warranted the switch. Do pay attention to care procedures though as that will greatly effect your experience.
review.name: I switched from the Platypus, to Grayl to this

review.reviewBody: Really convenient to have in the bag even for day hikes or in the truck as a safety in case I get stranded. I used it for several months traveling through SE Asia. The inside of the bag did get some slime in it which was easily cleaned out with some vinegar but I never got sick and drank some questionable stuff. Worth it for the convenience and to have as a backup for random situations.

name: BeFree 1L Tactical Microfilter

hasVariant.name: Back Up Line - 5mm
hasVariant.description: Buy the Beal Back Up Line - 5mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
So far just taken it out once to do 6 pitches at Index. We used it for hauling a mini metolius haul bag with food and water on an edelrid spoc. Easy to haul with on vertical terrain.

Then we used it to do full length rappels with a half gibbs knot alternating pulling skinny and pulling fat. We did a prerigged rappel and the leader used a grigri on the lead line. No issues with the rappels or retrieval except when rappelling with the skinny side threaded the knot did want to creep. To mitigate this the leader fixed the skinny rope at the bottom. Alternatively, one could add more friction with a second carabiner to the skinny rope. Just something to mindful of if you thread the rope with the skinny side in the chains.
review.name: Small and mighty

review.reviewBody: It's almost disturbing how thin and light this rope is. I use it for rigging static anchors above a cliff edge before transferring onto a dynamic rope on the cliff face. with 2 strands, it's surprisingly stable in a standard ATC style device (I use a giga jul) with 1 carabiner, tho 2 carabiners are recommended to increase friction. Works well as a tag line also, although you'll need to use a double flat overhand or a barrel knot to tie into your climbing rope due to the difference in width (and probably a reepshnur to safely block).
review.name: light as a feather

name: Back Up Line - 5mm

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these shoes, but they're just too wide&almost as wide as a men's shoe. I thought they would be OK so wore them on a few rides but find that my foot actually twists inside the shoe because I can't tighten them enough around the ankle. When I tighten the Velcro the shoe actually puckers and it's still too wide in the toe box. My feet are a bit narrow but not so much that I have to buy narrow shoes. I'm so sad these didn't work as I love my previous Giro shoes which fit perfectly, but are wearing out after three years of riding. I normally wear US size 9 and ordered these in 41 and the length is right, but the width&.ugh. If you have wide feet, these might be a great shoe but they just don't work for me.
review.name: Nice shoe but too wide

review.reviewBody:
I had my first pair I purchased 4 years ago.   Love them actually, they wore geat and just had issues with the labeling just fell off so decided to get new pair mind you the last pair were awesome and helped with Plantar fasciitis, I no longer have because of these shoes.
  Bought these new ones in August of 2020  Started wearing them on February of 2021 this year -  on and off (I knid of like the old pair - but going out I would wear the nice pair).  Just noticed that they have holes on both sides on both shoes by the front were the mesh and synthetic meet - kind of disappointing. They still look new. What a shame. I may contact the company who made them.
review.name: Something went wrong

review.reviewBody: This was my first pair of on cloud and I'm in love. I'm usually between 8 and 8.5 VERY happy I went with the 8.5 as they do fit very snug. I might even of gotten the 9. Comfortable and great for walking.
review.name: Great shoe - a little tight

review.reviewBody: I usually don't write reviews but I have to tell you how much I love my shoes! These shoes have seen many many miles and adventures so much that I finally broke down and purchased my second pair. They are so comfortable and fit like a glove. I love the reflective material for my night runs/walks and they are not too flashy to wear for my daily errands. I wear them to the gym, running, coffee stops and kid's softball and football games, doctor's appointment and more. If you are hard on your running shoes these are the BEST most durable shoes I have ever own!
review.name: My favorite running shoes of all time.

review.reviewBody: Not a good shoe
review.name: Did not like them

hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Midori 1 Tent: 1-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this tent for my first overnight hiking trip in the Pocono. This tent was super fast to put up after our long day hike and it is very light not adding too much weight to my pack. I was warm and it was easy to open the zippers for the many nighttime pee session. Love my tent!
review.name: So easy

review.reviewBody:
Great Tent...the Midori Back Country 1-person.  Will now be my "go-to" lightest weight backpacking tent.  My only critique is it would be great if it had a second door, but not a showstopper.

Thanks You, Eureka Tents
review.name: Midori Back Country 1-person Tent

review.reviewBody: Everything I expected it to be. It was light and of good quality. Good airflow. It rained the last night and I was nice and dry when I woke up.
review.name: Motorcycle camping

review.reviewBody: I haven't used it yet, but I do have the Midori 2 that I've used. I intend to use it with my smaller pack for one or two-night trips. I set it up in my living room and everything went well. I didn't even knock over anything with the poles! It was easy to cut out a plastic ground cover for underneath.
review.name: Perfect for smaller backpack

review.reviewBody: The tent is lightweight and easy to set up. It could be a little bit lighter, but it is a great budget-conscious option for solo backpackers.

Great solo tent, very roomy and easy to setup.
 Went backpacking around 11000 feet in late fall, wind gusts up to 70mph and this tent held up like a champ.
Small enough footprint to hide in the trees.

Only downside was the stakes that were supplied were a little too lightweight and bent easily.
 Love the supplied loft and the bonus vestibule on the back. 
The front vestibule was large enough to store my pack and the tent was a perfect height to make coffee in the morning without leaving the comfort of my sleeping bag. 
 Great windbreak from an otherwise miserable windy and cold weekend.
Packs down small enough to not have to strap on the outside of my pack as well.
 Yes there are lighter tents out there but they are mostly too compact, expensive and are made with ultralight/thin materials. 
This tent fit my price point perfectly.
review.name: Great solo tent, very roomy.

review.reviewBody:
My son and I had been splitting a Midori 3 between our packs for several seasons, and really liked the design, construction and features at its mid-level price point.  I needed a durable 1P tent for when sharing a tent wasn't possible, so it seemed like a no-brainer to go with the "little brother" of the product line—the Midori 1.  I did consider other tents, but kept coming back to this one for various reasons.  

Here is what I really like:
* Plenty of room to lie down (I'm 5'10"+ and I move around at night a fair bit)
* Lots of head and shoulder room; I can easily change clothes, sit up and make coffee in the vestibule, etc.  
* The third "spreader" pole vaults out the ceiling, makes the tent door vertical, and results in a spacious feel; also rain does not drip in as easily if the vestibule door is unzipped
* Good-sized main vestibule for my pack
* "Bonus" vestibule (with a short interior access zipper) to get other stuff out of the way
* Useful interior pockets
* Sturdy construction (not ultralight, so fabrics are thicker)
* designed for easy set-up
* Side door access; no shimmying in from the end
* The main tent is mostly mesh, meaning in another configuration it might make for a bug shelter underneath my ultralight backpacking tarp, and it also makes the inside feel more spacious as it "borrows" visual space from the fly.
* I tested it on a rainy weekend camp-out with the Scouts and it kept me nice and dry
* The price; this is a great value (I got mine as a Black Friday deal, which helped, too)

To be fair, there are downsides, but they are few:
* It's not the lightest thing in the world of backpacking tents (but to go much lighter you will generally need to either 1) spend a lot more for what's possibly a more fragile tent or 2) get something smaller that's potentially claustrophobic and less convenient to use)
* It doesn't come with a ground sheet; I made my own out of a large trash compactor bag as it was about the lightest solution I could think of
* One cost-saving move is the inclusion of standard shepherds hook stakes (although they are light aluminum ones); I replaced mine with MSR Mini Groundhogs but there are certainly other options

All in all, this is a great little tent.  I'd recommend it to anyone who wants a solid mid-range 1P tent at a reasonable cost, and favors moderate cost, livability and durability over achieving the absolute lowest pack weight.
review.name: Excellent Inexpensive Backpacking Tent

review.reviewBody:
My previous tent broke and I had to buy this one last minute for my trip down the GDMBR.  It worked out great. It was stable, light weight, and easy to set up after a long day of riding.  I stayed dry the whole time and had plenty of room.   The mesh pockets on the inside were great for storing belongings.  The rainfly rain extended far enough where I could store gear out of the elements but still in arms reach.   

My biggest complaint about this tent,  is that it doesn't have two doors. I know it's single person so you don't need to avoid climbing over someone to get out, but what if I wanna store more stuff under the rainfly and still have access to it? The side that doesn't have a door, does have a little zipper so you can reach outside of the tent if needed but it's not really practical (maybe I don't under the purpose of this zipper).   If it had two doors, you could put gear under both sides of the rainfly with access to all of it.  

A silly complaint, yet valid is: I wish the rainfly had two access points so you could roll up both sides to allow air flow through the tent. It's a great tent that traps the heat but when the bugs are bad, the sun is relentless and you have to spend time in the tent to escape both, not being able to get air flow through, however rare, is rough! 

Otherwise, this is a great tent that met all my needs.   Yes, I would recommend it while still airing my grievances.
review.name: Tent on GDMBR

review.reviewBody: THIS THING DOESNT KEEP RAIN OUT AND THE POLES ARE WEAKER THAN SOGGY NODDLES... IT IS NOT WEATHER RESISTANT AT ALL... YOU ARE BETTER OFF WITH A TRASH BAG!
review.name: WORST TENT EVER

review.reviewBody: I bought these after losing an old pair of Hestra “claws”. Only got a couple days of spring skiing in but they held up great to a spring snow dump and a slushy warm day. Almost too hot if it’s above 40 degrees F.
review.name: Cozy Warm and Dry

review.reviewBody: Really warm, no need for a liner, easy to get on, easy to strap your jacket, the bottom wraps around your jacket,   I expect using these for the next 10+ years
review.name: Best gloves I’ve ever had !

review.reviewBody: Ripped after one use. the palm is leather is light and can't withstand contact with any snow.
review.name: Leather is cheap

review.reviewBody: they look nice, but there is little to no insulation in these, so would not recommend for cold conditions.  They look good, but the function is poor and not worth the money.
review.name: little to no insulation

review.reviewBody: Fits a little snug especially with glove liners. Primary use is skiing but have used when building out door rink with fire hoses.  love the leashes to go around wrist.  Biggest complain is that the liner inside is not sewn in, and so if not careful when pulling hand out it pulls out them or fingers section, and can get stuck when putting back on.  This is something that i think would be good to be addressed in future.  Overall solid mitten for skiing
review.name: Works for ski mittens

review.reviewBody: This is my second season using these mittens (resort, 20+ days a year).  I like the fit and how the look. Seems durable too. the only problem is they are not warm enough on cold days.
review.name: Great fit, but cold

review.reviewBody:
Purchased Men's size Large, hand is 229mm around measured at V of thumb across palm and back of hand with Tape measure, coffee color.
Run true to size, liked the cuff really well with bulky ski jacket. Nice keeper straps with elastic. I don't tighten my mittens so I can't speak to the elastic cord.  Unfortunately, I'll be returning after just three days of use.  The first two days, in colder 20's fahrenheit my fingers were marginally cold if not cold.  Third day it was warm skiing 34 degrees and wet and my hand got wet and I mean very wet.  I did not remove my mittens they just didn't stay dry.  The insulation is also very "dense" feeling.  I think this would be an acceptable product, but I'm used to backcountry branded gear being exceptional, not just acceptable.  I'll be returning and dropping more coin to have Hestra's again, which have treated me very well for years.  If it's any interest, I'm replacing brand new Dakine mittens because they wouldn't get a one star in my opinion.  the cuff is all WHACKY, so maybe I'm just a very picky person??, Sorry Backcountry.  I'll try again later.
review.name: Backcountry Goretex snow mitten review

review.reviewBody: They are super warm no need to wear liner gloves under them. The only thing is I feel like they got stretched out after the first wear so maybe size down
review.name: warm

review.reviewBody:
Picked up a pair of these gloves for the coming season. I haven't got to get out on the mountain with them too much yet but they feel great and are packed with features. 

First off, they look great. I got the pika/black color and they couldn't look more clean. They feel great when you put them on, the liner is super soft and they're toasty. I got the medium size and the gauntlet comes halfway up my forearm, there's a strap around your wrist you can tighten and a pull cord at the end of the gauntlet that you can tighten too, both are easy to operate with the mittens on. My favorite little detail is the loops that are at the top of the mitten, so you can hang them with the opening facing downwards and really let them dry out after a long day.
review.name: Great Style and Feel

review.reviewBody: These mittens look, feel, and fit great. The gauntlet style is easy to pull on and off, and the wrist strap and drawcord allow for a customized fit. I used these in conjunction with a pair of Burton Touchscreen liners and my hands stayed dry and warm all day on the mountain. The leashes are comfortable and unobtrusive so you never have to worry about losing them when taking them off. My biggest complaint and cause for concern is the goatskin for the fingertip portion of the mitten is very thin. In my first time using them on some groomers with mild ice, the leather is already torn/ripped. For the price point, I expected better durability out of these.
review.name: Great style/function, durability suspect

name: GORE-TEX All-Mountain Mitten

review.reviewBody: The waterproofing is excellent. However the jacket is not robus. I have a wear/cut where my rack sack goes over the neck. Hardly a high impact area. Look elsewhere with protective areas for serious users.
review.name: Not robust

review.reviewBody:
This jacket was a game changer for me.
I run hot.
I simply cannot tolerate high-output activities in conventional shell jackets- no matter how well they claim to “breathe”.  Even in the most expensive waterproof-breathable jacket I end up drenched in sweat (even when Nordic ski touring at -40C).  This jacket has proven to be the ultimate combination of materials and design to both keep me warm from wind and cold, as well as BREATHE.  I finally have a jacket that I can climb hills/mountains and charge on my skis without getting dangerously wet from sweat.

Some important points.  This jacket can only really be treated with wax on the G-1000 panels (e.g. shoulders and arms)- so it cannot be waterproofed like other Fjallraven jackets with total G-1000 coverage.  That being said- for high output trekking/climbing- this jacket is the bomb- offering a superb balance of breathability and protection from weather.  And if you treat the G-1000 panels with wax, they shed precipitation and snow beautifully!

Sizing.  Follow Fjallraven’s size recommendation.  I am 178cm (5’10”) tall and a physically-fit 86kg (190lbs).  Fjallraven consistently recommends a size-Large for me (and generally fit is bang on- Medium would be too small).  Although I do not think of myself as a “Large” man- I have relatively broad, thick shoulders.  I have tried on many size-Medium Fjallraven tops/jackets (and own a number of them), and- although there is enough volume through the torso in a Medium- I simply cannot get a Medium to fit me through the chest and shoulders- I have consistently needed a Large.  I have tried on a Medium in this jacket, and it fits nicely until I try to zip it up to my chin- I can’t even get it closed!  In the Large, I can fit an insulated mid-layer underneath.

This jacket is not as versatile as some of the other Fjallraven jackets.  For example, I also own the Skogso- it is more versatile as it can be entirely treated with wax, making it effectively waterproof.  The Keb jacket however breathes better.  Perhaps the Kaipak (which I have never tried) is the sweet spot between the two?  The Skogso is my everyday jacket.  The Keb is my high-output trekking-ski touring jacket.
Highly recommended!
review.name: Durable Trekking Jacket For High-Output and Those that Run Hot!

review.reviewBody: Other than heavy rain, this jacket will be a great addition to your adventuring wardrobe. I practically live in my Keb pants, and love the fabrics, so I knew I'd like the jacket. Perfect amount of stretch, and toughness. I have yet to "break" anything on my pants or jacket and Fjallraven has a good policy if anything breaks.
review.name: Keb jacket is great for almost every condition

review.reviewBody:
Love these jackets I own 2. They are some of the most versatile and durable pieces you can find, rugged enough to hike through forest and rock, water repellent enough for even medium rain, really well vented for a great range of temps and climates and wind resistant enough for almost any climate, paired with its own keb hoody or just a thick wool sweater or fleece it?s basically a rugged low tech winter shell for skiing too. I grab these almost every time I go out and especially if I?m worried about damaging a fragile gore Tex type shell or if it?s gonna be jammed down in a pack, I dot have to worry about this one getting damaged. And if it ever does it?s super field repairable . The wax system is not fully waterproof it will soak over time and needs redoing every so often depending on the level of water and wind repellence you desire (vs breath ability) but not more than once a year and it?s fun. Just use a blow dryer basically to melt it in evenly wherever you want extra repellence. 

Great tall collar also, that?s the original reason I bough it, great for windy days and cold nights.

Has chest pockets and side zips for venting heat and reaching inside to pants pockets, vest pocket, insulation layer pocket etc.

I?m 6?1, 33 waist have a size M though L would work as well.
review.name: Versatile and tough

review.reviewBody: I got this to act as a shell to one of my Lite Abisko puffy jackets to act as a windbreak. The side vents match up perfectly with the pockets of my puffy, and my jacket doesn't look like a snowman suit. I love that it has some great 4-way stretch so I can reach into my backpacking rig on long hikes without feeling restricted.
review.name: Great pairing jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket like the pants eliminates most jackets from my arsenal. It is my go to from day hikes to ski touring. With lots of stretch and breathe-ability the Keb Jacket  keeps me cool when it gets hot. Also love the storm hood!
review.name: The quiver killer

review.reviewBody: I love the fit of this jacket. The online size guide really helped me to workout the best size for me. A problem with other coats is that as they get larger, the waist flares disproportionately, not a problem with this jacket.
review.name: Excellent, snug fitting coat

review.reviewBody: Fits incredibly well and the materials/construction are exactly what I was looking for. The collar on the jacket is the only thing I am still struggling with, the hood is a nice tunnel hood. But when the hood is laying back, the collar looks a little awkward.
review.name: Keb Jacket

review.reviewBody: did not use it as it was too small but looked like it might be a great jacket although a little too noisey for my taste built to last forever however
review.name: I returned it...large too small 6 ft 185

name: Keb Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
The garment is high quality, as is our experience of all Rab clothing.
The fit is excellent. It is wonderful to have the stuff sack so that the gilet will pack down small.
review.name: The garment is high quality,

review.reviewBody: Having owned the Electron pro vest I was excited to get my hands on this one for an inbetween layer. I fit of the this vest is quite sloppy, boxy and long. Which I was not expecting from Rab. I returned this vest and will stick to my Electron pro vest.
review.name: Was not thrilled by this vest

review.reviewBody:
For the past few of years or so I have been wearing the Microlight Vest (size large) which I combined with the Microlight Alpine Jacket (size extra large) when it gets particularly cold. Due to putting on a bit of weight over the year, the vest has become a bit tight, so I have had to get a larger size vest.
As an all season hiker in North York Moors and Peak District these have served me very well in the winter months. They hold their fill very well and hold up well to windy conditions. I have worn them as a combination in -10 and moderate winds of 15 mph and they keep me toasty warm. I haven't tried them in extreme weather, but they were not designed for extreme conditions! I have kept them dry, so cannot say how they would hold up if wet. In high winds or when it rains I put on my hydroshell elite, to keep my warm and happy. I have no doubt that the extra large vest will perform as well as the large one has.
The only negative point was that I did not receive a stuff sack with the extra large vest. When I bought my extra large jacket and my old large vest they both came with stuff sacks. It would have been nice if Rab still provided stuff sacks with their products.
review.name: For the past few of

review.reviewBody:
The Fit is perfect, warm comfortable does what it says on the tin. 
Another great garment from Rab
review.name: The Fit is perfect, warm

review.reviewBody: Good fit, weight just right , ideal for early morning autumnal walks, will be used extensively as a layer in colder climates.
review.name: Good fit, weight just right

review.reviewBody: It's that time of year again when the Microlight Vest becomes pack of the daily packing regime. Wearing it as stand alone on top of base or mid layers off season, as part of layering system for winter. Best for moderate activity as down tends to get a bit damp and compact. Decent value and good warmth for weight ratio. Logos did come off during washing though.
review.name: Microlight Down Vest

name: Microlight Vest - Men's

description: Buy the Aeroe Quick Mount Pod online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Quick Mount Pod
hasVariant.description: Buy the Aeroe Quick Mount Pod online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a 7-day backcountry mountain bike trip.  The design is very cool and practical.  Not too heavy (~7lbs for the full setup), and the ability to easily adjust the orientation is great.  While my bags held up fine, my riding partner (who had the same setup) had both bags break on days 2 and 3 while riding the fire road.  The portion of the bag that connected to the frame mount just sheared right off.  With no way to fix the mount we were forced to abandon the bag on the side of the trail and tie all of his belongings to our bikes.  So, if you're considering these for commuting or super mellow gravel, go for it.  If you're thinking about putting them on a MTB, think again!  Go for the dry bag setup...much more durable design.
review.name: Road Yes...MTB NO!!!!

name: Quick Mount Pod

review.reviewBody: So sad. Ordered a large for my husband the first time, and the zippers didn’t work. But it FIT. Ordered another large and the zippers worked, but the size was too small (a large again). Would never order.   Haven’t returned yet but will. Never worn
review.name: Bad sizing.

review.reviewBody:
As someone who tends to run hot while snowboarding it was absolutely necessary for me to find a good lightweight alternative to my primary (heavyweight) jacket. Overall, I love the look and feel of this jacket and it's been great both on and off the hill. While it's not perfect, it does the trick!

WARMTH: This is a true shell with zero insulation. Paired with my bombproof bibs and a long-sleeve base layer, this is great for touring or warmer days. Part of me wishes that the pit-zips had mesh, but I also like that they're open because it affords easy access to the chest pocket of my snow pants without unzipping the jacket.

FIT: It's shorter than I anticipated, but the sleeves are a great length and it's baggy enough to layer and move around while riding without feeling like I bought the wrong size. The hood is HUGE! While it's nice that it fits over a helmet, I'm often trying to fold it up to avoid a parachute from forming behind my head.

APPEARANCE: It's a sleek and simple shell with only the two side pockets and a hidden internal (insulated!) phone pocket in the chest. I like the pattern and colors, but I also like that it has hi-vis orange accents inside the hood and wrists; I do a fair amount of off-piste/backcountry riding, so I like this being an option without looking like I'm on traffic detail 24/7.

MISC: I'm a packrat, so if I didn't already have pockets galore on my pants, I might want another one or two on this.
review.name: A Solid Shell

name: Ullr D Shell Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Super soft and nice and relaxed without looking bummy. Will buy in lots more colors!

review.reviewBody:
I'll start by saying that overall I really love these joggers and have several pairs. They're comfortable, relatively flattering, and I like the colors, and I like that they look somewhat elevated so you can wear them out of the house. 

I ordered these a year ago and would say I wear them every few weeks or so (since I rotate my various athleticwear). I wash them in the machine but I always hang them dry, so I was shocked to discover yesterday morning that the fabric is already starting to get holes in it. My 'wear and tear' on these have been pretty light, so that's been disappointing. Since there's holes in them these will now have to stay "house clothes" instead of something I can wear out.
review.name: Getting holes after less than a year of wear

review.reviewBody: Great joggers! I've been saving up to buy these and now wear them all the time! They are stylish and cute, with a relaxed fit. Perfect for around the house and while running errands.
review.name: Great joggers!

review.reviewBody: These joggers are so wonderful I immediately ordered a second pair. They feel light and luxuriant. I wish there were more colors to choose from. I'm about 5'8" and the length hits above the ankles, which is the way they look on the model, but I found myself wishing there was an option to order "long".

description: Buy the Northwave Rockit Plus Mountain Bike Shoe online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Rockit Plus Mountain Bike Shoe
hasVariant.description: Buy the Northwave Rockit Plus Mountain Bike Shoe online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've had quite a few pairs of cycling shoes, but these are by far the most comfortable.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody:
I ended up returning these but it was hard to do.  

These were so comfortable!!  The ripstop uppers were soft and cushy, but the fit was dialed in with the, um, dial.   These were tied with Shimano SH-EX702 for me.   Both shoes have similar stiffness, but the Rocket Plus felt more plush.  I felt the release mechanism on the Boa dial was slightly more convenient on the 702s.   But the NW Rocket Plus allows for incremental loosening of the dial which the Boa on the 702s doesn't do.  It was a hard choice and I think would be happy with either shoe.  

I found them to fit true to size (NW had a nice size chart on their site) and felt that the overall quality is on par with most big brands.   

These are not for the racers or anyone who wants a really stiff performance shoe, but they felt stiff enough for MTBing where you spend much of the time out of the saddle...even for a person my size (260lbs).  I would happily use these for MTB, road, gravel, and bikepacking.  

I also tried the NW Corsair and NW X-Trail Plus shoes.   The X-Trail Plus shoe was very similar to this shoe except the uppers were made of a more traditional "leather" material.  I felt that the Corsairs were going to be too soft for MTBing at my size.
review.name: A solid shoe that feels like slippers!

name: Rockit Plus Mountain Bike Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: True to size, excellent materials, gresr sole! Time will tell how the materials age. It's the second pair we buy from the brand, and they are awesome, durable and comfortable!
review.name: Great product!

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I waited for over a month to leave this review, as I kept thinking the boots just needed more break-in time. Alas, after wearing them multiple times, I’ve concluded they simply aren’t comfortable. They are also difficult/nearly impossible to re-lace, because the eyelets are poorly designed/defunct. I appreciate they are waterproof, but overall, I’m disappointed and would not purchase these boots again.
review.name: Not Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the color. But i was not a fan of the thick upper part around the ankle. I also found these to be on the heavier side. Ran narrow and on the smaller side. Not for me.
review.name: Not a fan

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are great for someone looking for the support of a high top boot without the weight. They are super durable and held up well on a rafting trip through the Yukon, British Columbia, and Alaska. They kept my feet warm and dry around camp and had a fantastic supportive footbed and grippy sole for hiking. They do run rather small and narrow, so I recommend trying these on to see what size and width works best for you!
review.name: Durable Boot Without the Weight

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: When the box first arrived, it was so light I thought there had to be a mistake. These boots are half the weight of any other hiking boot I’ve worn, yet still highly supportive. The Vibram soles offer great traction and waterproof qualities unbelievable.
review.name: So comfortable and lightweight!
comment: This is so exciting! I am so glad you love them!

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These were comfortable right out of the box.  Great looking and durable.  I use them for work and am on my feet quite a bit and have had no issues with breaking in.  I wish they came in more colors, I would get another pair.
review.name: Love these! Get them!
comment: I'm so glad you love the design and feel overall! We hope to serve you again in the future!

name: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I unfortunately like this shoe.   But definitely don’t purchase them knowing they will have a long life.  This pair is showing wear already after only two months and less than 50 miles.
review.name: I wish they would hold up longer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the styling and color combo on these shoes. Outdoorsy but also fun with a pop of color. They are very lightweight and feel supportive on my sole and arch. They have nice grip and are perfect for hiking or trails. Strangely, they cause my feet to tingle. I’ve loosened them but they still cause this somewhat uncomfortable feeling.
review.name: Stylish and Supportive

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable shoes that provide balance of cushion and firmness. The textured bottoms helps with grip! They are breathable and so far have held up!
The tan color goes will with outfits looks cute!
review.name: Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shoes are extremely comfortable straight out of the box.  They are supportive and comfortable, have great traction on paths and trails. Fit was true to size for me. I am very thankful for this incentivized item since I was introduced to my new go-to shoe.
review.name: Comfort right out of the box

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really want to love these! I love the color and it’s not an excessive amount of height or cushion added like hokas… felt really comfortable walking around and then I went to go run a quick mile and my 3 last toes were rubbing against the shoe so much i was ready to get home already. Took the shoe off and my toes were bleeding… what the heck?
review.name: Not sure what is going on here

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shoes are really cool. I love the wide toe box. I  love the design and color scheme. They are a bit narrow so I sized up from a 6.5 to a 7.5. They seem good with minimal friction,  causing blisters. They feel like they are breaking down a tad bit by the back of the heel where it sits on the upper back of my foot. I feel steady in these shoes but they are tight across bridge area of foot. The traction is great! I think I would purchase these shoes again but I don’t think they will be my go to because they are so narrow. After my run my feet, being swollen, felt like a sausage in a tight contraption.
review.name: These are cute!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I want to reiterate how much I love Altra shoes and had three different pairs prior to testing the Timp 5’s. Before purchasing my Lone Peaks, I was looking at the Timps! I have always had a great experience with Altra so I was pretty shocked when my shoes came with a missing right insole. Given that I had three other pairs, one of them being retired running shoes, I swapped those insoles for the new ones,and didn’t miss a beat.

Why Altra?  If you have bad feet like me, you will appreciate the wide toe box during a hike or run to allow your feet to spread out. (Your back will thank you later)The Timp 5’s weren’t as wide as I would have liked them to be but I was able to adjust the laces to make them wider. I do appreciate that they weren’t heavy either which made trail running more efficient, and one less factor to deal with.

Even with the hiccup, altras will forever be my go to. 🫶
review.name: A bit narrow for Altas!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shoes run a bit small so I had to order the next size up. The toe width is a bit narrow compared to my other low peak shoes. Overall it’s still a great shoe and the color is pretty.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am a HUGE Altra fan and have the Paradigm 6 and 7. I will never buy another running shoe brand! The wider toe box allows for a nice toe splay. I did need to adjust the laces so they fit comfortably, but after that they were great. They have incredible traction from the Vibram sole. I highly recommend!!
review.name: Good foot feel, wide toe box

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] New running shoes! Good cushioning and the toe box is wide for added comfort. There is good traction at the bottom. The shoe is a bit stiff so you’ll need to break them in but do get more comfortable with wear.
review.name: Great running shoes

name: Timp 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Union Lace Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ordered a size 9.5, which fox says is 42.5 in euro.   According to every other shoe manufacturer, a size 42.5 is closer to a size 8.5, and lo and behold, these fit like an 8.5.  Go off of the euro sizing, not the U.S. sizing.   And backcountry charges shipping on returns, so I guess I'm going back to boycotting backcountry for both their dumb IP litigation practices and their crappy return policy.
review.name: Sizing is wildly off

description: Buy the Hydrapak ULTRAFLASK SPEED 600ml Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: ULTRAFLASK SPEED 600ml Water Bottle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydrapak ULTRAFLASK SPEED 600ml Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These bottles are very easy to use. They are easy to fill easy to drink from and the hose is easy to trim to the exact length you need. I’ve only used them a few times, but they seem to be very durable.
review.name: Great soft flasks

review.reviewBody: These fit perfectly into the pockets of my hydration vest AND in the pockets of my Janji Trail shorts. I love how easy they are to clean, how lightweight they are, and how they collapse as you drink from them. They truly are spill proof/leak proof. Major hydration game changer! Going to purchase the water bladder next!
review.name: Perfect for trail running/hiking/and beyond!

review.reviewBody: I have only used one of the two and after 3 times running, it leaks. Bummer. I read folks complained about taste... I didn't have that issues after rinsing the flak out a few times.
review.name: Return needed
comment:
Thank you for the feedback, we appreciate it! We can gladly replace your leaking Ultraflask under our warranty program, since it is not functioning as intended. Please file a claim here:
https://support.hydrapak.com/hc/en-us

After you have filed a claim, we will respond to your ticket very quickly, usually within 1-2 days.

Thank you!

review.reviewBody: Great product - fits perfectly in the front chest pouches of my Nathan trial vest.
review.name: Great fit, easy to hydrate

review.reviewBody: This flask is great! Fit easily into hydration vest pocket and extended straw easy to use
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: Love these flasks.  Replaced the flasks that originally came with my Solomon vest.  The UltraFlasks are SO much better.  I love that the tops have a ridge which, when I stretch the strap around them, prevents them from migrating lower into the vest pockets...they stay in place (the originals were always slipping down).  Also love the 2 top options.  I have used both the original and the hose attachments (settled on the hose attachment as it makes it easier for me to drink) and really appreciate both options, especially since I had to replace the original flasks because the tops got destroyed.  Great product!
review.name: Better than the flasks that came with Salomon Vest

review.reviewBody: I use these as a replacement for my Salomon flasks (also made by HyroPack) as I find that the screw tops can be difficult (and especially when I need them to work most -- at an aid station).  I've never had them pop open even when I throw an extra flask or two in my pack.  I also find that they stay upright in the vest better than the stock Salomon flasks.
review.name: Great Upgrade vs. Salomon Stock Flasks

review.reviewBody:
I have been using the standard Salomon 500ml versions in my ADV vest but wanted some extra capacity on certain longer, dry runs.  These fit in the vest perfectly and I was able to custom cut the extensions to the perfect length.

The flip top takes just a bit of getting used to to both make sure it securely closes (push until you get a VERY pronounces "snap") and getting that snap without spraying fluid everywhere (hang on only to the rim of the flask, not the flask itself).

Couldn't be happier.  LOVE THEM!!
review.name: These 600ml versions do fit in the Salomon vests

review.reviewBody: The best bottles. I ordered a second set so I can quickly switch them with my crew at races. I find the flip cap is a game changer when hitting aid stations
review.name: Great race bottle

review.reviewBody: Awesome soft flasks. They fit in a lower pocket my arc teryx vest. Now I can carry just over 2 liters of water with ease.
review.name: Great flasks

name: ULTRAFLASK SPEED 600ml Water Bottle

review.reviewBody: I've had the RUX Waterproof Bag for almost a year now and find myself using it even more than I anticipated. Running errands? Yup, the shoulder strap makes carrying a bunch of stuff easy. Headed to the beach? Definitely - Load it up. Heading out on the water? No problem. The hidden roll-top will keep everything perfectly dry... even if you happen to dump it overboard. Need to put it down in the snow? All good, it's waterproof. Need somewhere for your wet wetsuit when you get back to the car? Toss it in the Waterpoof Bag and the rest of your car won't get wet. And if it's a little dirty at the end of the day? Welp, just hose it out and it'll be good as new. Bonus feature is how well it fits into the RUX 70L - it takes up about 50% of the space in there. And if you really want to up your game, you can always attach the RUX pocket to the outside to keep your smalls organized and secure (see photo).
review.name: High quality, versatile and functional

name: Waterproof 25L Bag

review.reviewBody: These are by far the most comfortable base layer pants I have ever worn. Instead of the typical elastic waist band, they have more of a seamless waist which makes it more comfortable.

Huge improvement over my previous winter tights. Agree with a previous poster that they do fit a little oddly. They don't really consider that a woman has hips. But they have enough material that the waist to make it work. Very warm for little bulk and that's the main job.
These are so comfortable I can live in them. Great for 25-40 degree F days of outdoor activity as an only base layer. So good I bought two.
review.name: Excellent mid weight base layer

review.reviewBody: Small in the bum and loose in the waist, these tights do not stay up. Because of this I rarely reach for them.
review.name: These do not stay up

review.reviewBody: I love my new trift leggings. I haven't even taken them out in the snow yet, but they form the perfect layer under some shorts or a cute mini skirt to keep me warm in Northern California. Never overly insulated and holding up well with the wear so far. Only note is they run a little big, so maybe order a size down from your normal if you want a tight fit!

name: Trift Long Tights - Women's

review.reviewBody: Looks great. Was 100% effective in light rain but not so much in a downpour.
review.name: Good light rain jacket

review.reviewBody: I had to return this rain jacket is not lightweight plus the sound the jacket made was annoying not to mention very boxy runs large a medium fits like a large
review.name: I would not buy this product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had to sent the old damaged one for repair. It was beyond repair item. Their guaranty products and customer services are excellent! The new one has beautiful hue. Functionality was good. I missed the old one. It went to a newest design fir a semi light wind winter jacket a 300. This new one design is less complex, less features! What I like the most was their special wing proof coat lining! Missing the foldable hood and velcro snap. Missing front closure velcro. Old one was more solid built and top stitching on it. Inner pocket was harder and top shell as well. Please! I do not intend to offend no one here. I wanted to express my honest experiences on this type of garment high performances. The North face wind and winter coat are Super!! Many thanks!
review.name: Loving colors theme

review.reviewBody: I loved a beautiful jacket. I loved the color. It's very comfortable for the rain in New York City
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: Fit's perfect. Im 5'1 128lb. Bought small. It's fit perfect. So comfy
review.name: Never failed at North face

review.reviewBody: I loved a beautiful jacket. I loved the color. It's very comfortable.
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: Love the color..so stylish! Wore it in the rain and remained dry!
review.name: Perfect rainy weather jacket

review.reviewBody: I like the fit and color. I'm more on the petite side so the length was also not too cropped. The one thing I didn't was the drawstring at the bottom which was too long and could have benefitted from having clips on the end.
review.name: Nice jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the waterproof feature of the rain jacket ! Nice color
review.name: Perfect rainy weather jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice and easy rain jacket. Not too short in body (but I am short, so it hits perfect, could be short if you are really tall). Fit is a little oversized, but I like it. Not tight on tummy, and room for a long sleeve layer in my arms and body. It sounds a little crunchy as you move but most rain jackets do. White color is clean and crisp looking. 175lbs, 5ft, bought an xl.
review.name: Nice jacket!

name: Antora Rain Hooded Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Cirque 35L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cirque 35L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Cirque 35L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cirque 35L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Cirque 35L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This pack is very light and for my use, I should have bought a heavier pack with more of a frame. The lack of frame in this pack makes it very uncomfortable to carry for long 12+ hour days. It’s fine for short half day tours where ski carry isn’t required, but I find this pack miserable on long days. Because it has no frame, it doesn’t carry weight well and it requires a perfectly stuffed pack to make A-frame ski carry not lopsided. I’m also small, so the waist belt does not go tight enough to alleviate the pain in my shoulders from the unsupportive pack. 

This pack is nice for carrying the basics for ski touring (including ice axe loops and helmet carry), but I wish it had a back panel for easier access as the side zipper isn’t very helpful. Also, when using a-frame carry the side zipper is inaccessible. Lastly, I really wish this pack had an outside water bottle pocket for warmer weather touring.
review.name: Super uncomfortable for big days.

review.reviewBody: It has everything I need, and it’s lightweight. It is easy to open and close even with gloves on. And has the perfect amount of pockets.
review.name: I love this pack.

review.reviewBody: Great features for backcountry travel and carrying avalanche gear, light weight, lots of capacity, comfortable to wear. I love this pack.
review.name: Sweet pack!

review.reviewBody:
After procrastinating for several years I decided to get a new ski pack. Loaded it up and loved the fit and the way it carries a load. My mind struggled a bit with the lack of pockets for miscellaneous stuff, but I have worked that out. 
If you are thinking about this pack, do it!
review.name: Loved it immediately.

review.reviewBody:
This pack is amazing. Everything is "in the right place". Helmet, shovel, probe, water bladder perfectly snug. Interior space is plenty for food, skins, puffy layer and shell. 
And most importantly the way the pack moves with your body while skiing is magical... I truly forget that it is on my back!
review.name: One with the skier!

review.reviewBody: Super good pack but I find weird that some straps are hanging too much in your back.
review.name: Really good backpack

review.reviewBody:
The Cirque 35 is my everyday ski pack. It’s large enough for multi-day but trips. If I needed to carry a rope and webbing, I would purchase the larger Cirque 40. The pack is simple, light, carries well, without too many outside straps. 
For summer skiing, I wish that the pack was compatible with an inside water bladder. If there was a small sew-in Velcro tab, I could easily hang a bladder within the small inside pocket.
review.name: Very nice backcountry ski pack

review.reviewBody: One of my favorite ski mountaineering packs. Love the food pocket on the hip so you don’t have to stop to grab a bite. The side zip to the main compartment let’s you get in easy. Also, the Avy compartment is great also for keeping your shovel and probe separated.
review.name: Thoughtful ski mountaineering pack

review.reviewBody: I have fall in love with the pack so far. A very great ski pack, very handly for touring. I would like to see BD make pack for summet trekking too.
review.name: Very good pack

review.reviewBody:
I'm very pleased with this pack - it's carries skis well, opens beautifully when skis are mounted (which almost no pack does), and it accommodate ice tools on the back (which is increasingly being left off other ski packs). 

The only thing I don't love is the placement of the zippered pocket at the top. You need a quickly accessible zippered pocket on a pack that doesn't require un-cinching the main compartment to access. This pocket is the only one on the pack and is an awkward shape and in an awkward location. BD would be better off moving this zipper down the pack a few inches so that it doesn't require the un-cinching the main compartment to access.
review.name: Smart design clearly made by people who love to backcountry ski.

name: Cirque 35L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Cloudsurfer Trail Waterproof Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes perform very well. They’re relatively light, very comfortable on the trail and also feel good on pavement. I’ve found the Cloudultra to be satisfactory but not very durable and the Cloudventure Peak to be unsatisfactory (uppers were more durable but shoe design and materials meant they collected tons of debris and the laces came undone without double knots). These shoes fixed all those problems and run great.
review.name: They Got It Right

name: Cloudsurfer Trail Waterproof Running Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Zempire Zeus Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Zeus Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Zempire Zeus Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've had a Zeus for about 8-9 years and it's been my extreme weather camp ever since I got it. No leaks, fast and easy to set up, easy to see and find in the dark, room for 2 or room for me, my dog and gear. It's a bit heavy compared to some tents but the performance and reliability is worth the extra weight and pack size. The fly has just started wetting in the last few trips so I'm going to try reproof it and if that doesn't help then I'll be getting another Zeus.
review.name: Great tent, highly reccomended

review.reviewBody:
I will preface this review by stating I have not yet used the tent outdoors as it was purchased for an upcoming trip
The tent was really fast to set up - having colour coded pegs to match where they go really helped it go up quickly (probably 5 mins) as did the fact that the poles are actually all linked. It packs up relatively small and while its not a super light tent its also not a real heavyweight either. Plenty of interior space and height in particular for me.
review.name: Great so far!

review.reviewBody: My mate was tarping, we got hit some real heavy rain so got him to come in with me. Had enough room for all our gear. I use the footprint for extra protection. Really happy with the tent. The red strapping you see is something that I use to set up tent during rain to keep the inner and footprint dry during set up.
review.name: All I need!

review.reviewBody:
Bought for heli-hunting trips where I can carry a bit of gear. Super easy to set up and roomy for my tall frame, pole design gives vertical ends so no pressing against a wet outer.
With the inner being entirely mesh expect to feel the breeze more than a solid weave fabric. Great for hot nights, less so for weather that condenses insider the outer. Perhaps an option Zempire might consider for NZ?
Overall got what I expected and satisfied with that. Quality of manufacture was faultless and the zips were smoothest I have met in a tent!
 Not a tent for gales, use terrain and trees to break the wind.
review.name: Very good sheltered campsite tent..

review.reviewBody: Quick and easy setup and pack down. Lightweight and functional. Have yet to find out how durable it is with such thin materials but looking forward to see how it performs.
review.name: Quick and Easy

name: Zeus Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: Had to return a medium because it was too small despite ordering per size guide. Had the same thing happen with Smith Nexus helmet. Yet my Smith mtn bike helmet fits fine in a medium using same sizing chart. I'm giving Smith 1 star here because getting sizing right is critical and they have obviously messed this up with ski helmets.
review.name: Smith Vantage helmet runs small

review.reviewBody: Very nice helmet. I have a more oval shaped head, and the XL fit kinda snug. Just room for a thin balaclava, so it really wasn't really warm enough below about 15 degrees F. I skied with this all season and finally, this spring I removed the ear pads for a warm day, and WOW, the whole helmet fit way better and there's now room for a much thicker balaclava! The problem is the connecting piece of fabric along the back of the neck that holds the ear pads together. It's made out of 2 or more layers of very thick foam-backed fabric. It takes up a lot of room, and really screws up the fit of the whole helmet for me. Next stop: I will cut up the ear pieces so they are just two separate ear pads. Not the most elegant solution, but I see now that it is absolutely necessary. SMITH needs to sell different ear pads - some with just a thin piece of fabric connecting the ear pads. I took one star off just for that, it screws up my fit so much.
review.name: Remove the ear pads

review.reviewBody: Don’t waste your time and money on Vantage helmets which are not properly designed. Tha helmet had a set of rubber band bungees in the back the are supposed to hold your goggles strap in place. The problem is that after a short time that rubber bungee stretches out. Recently, I lost a pair of Oakley goggles that way. Luckily, someone was kind enough to turn them in to lost and found.
review.name: Skier

review.reviewBody: This helmet adjusts to fit perfectly and is really comfortable and warm. Vents work great and I love the flexibility of the dual vent system. Obviously a quality helmet compared to the others I tried on
review.name: Super comfortable helmet

review.reviewBody: Great ski helmet fits perfectly based on the measurement of my head. I tried other brand ski goggles with it but they didn’t fit that well so I purchased Smith OTG goggles and I’m set to go. Very happy and ordering online was easy and they were delivered on time.
review.name: Great ski helmet fits perfectly

review.reviewBody: Excellent helmet, super comfortable with great ventilation.
review.name: Excellent helmet, super comfortable with

review.reviewBody: Love the new helmet. Integrated with goggles. Works well.
review.name: Good fit

review.reviewBody:
Fits great with adjustment wheel. Comfortable.
Nylon wire sometimes causes pain on ear. Should be able to fix with tape.
Lower section of helmet changed color/faded and no longer matches top.
review.name: Fits great with adjustment wheel.

review.reviewBody: This thing is warm, ventilates well, protects well, fits perfectly, easy to adjust. There are no complaints. This is the helmet you want.
review.name: Best ski helmet around

review.reviewBody: overall, a good helmet. used it 3 times this ski season. good fit, insulation, and ventilation. though I do not like the goggle retention. I would rather have something a bit better than a simple bungy. also, it can be a little hard to feel the ventilation tabs when wearing gloves/mittens.
review.name: overall, a good helmet. used

name: Vantage Helmet
