hasVariant.name: Speed Lite SL 23L Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Deuter Speed Lite SL 23L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I shopped for MONTHS looking for the right pack that had all the features I wanted.  I loved the idea that this was a womens fit pack.  I loved the pockets on the front straps, I loved the pocket on the waist strap, and I loved that it had loops for hiking poles.  However, when I got the pack my initial impression was that it fit weird on my back.  After wearing it around the house, I thought I had it adjusted in a way that would work for me.  I took off the tags.  But after wearing it on my first hike of the summer, I decided it just isn't going to work for me.  I don't love that there is only one compartment.  The hiking poles don't really lay how I need them to, they flop around too much.  But the thing that made me realize this is NOT the pack for me, was where the bladder hose comes through the bag.  I feel like I must be doing it wrong because it kinks the hose so badly I couldn't drink from it.  I had two other people look at it to see if I was doing something wrong and they couldn't figure it out either.  Poor, poor design.  I ended up bringing my bladder hose through the main zipper and just not zipping it closed all the way.  Really wanted to love it.  Thought I had found THE pack.  But this is not it for me.
review.name: Wanted to love it ...

review.reviewBody: Came bent in half and frame broken. Who would bend that and shove it in a package like that? Now it’s worthless. Will never order from here again.
review.name: Came bent and broken

review.reviewBody: I had to return this pack because it just didn’t fit right. I tried to adjust it, but it just rode too high and hit me in the neck. That was unfortunate because I love the running style straps and side pockets.
review.name: I had to return

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love my Deuter Speed Lite 23 SL.  What a game changer when hiking!  I love the comfortable straps, the pouch for my water bladder, and the waste strap. The material is light also, which is a plus for those hot days. The quality is on-point with this backpack.  I can't wait to take it on longer trips. Highly recommended!
review.name: Deuter Speed Lite 23 SL

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received our Speed Lite 23 SL trail backpack. My wife uses it when we hit the trails near our house. It's super light weight, and well constructed with super strong stiching. There are many storage compartments to store all her gear. We will definitely buy and use more of these products in the future, and would recommend this backpack to all our family and friends. This is definitely a winner!!!!!
review.name: Best Light WeightTrail Backpack Ever!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Deuter Speed Lite 23 SL back pack is so pretty and functional! I love the look amd how light it feels on my back.  This is the perfect backpack for walking, hiking or even traveling.  And it comes with a lifetime warranty!
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have had the pleasure of testing out for free a Speed Lite Series Hiking Backpack from @deuter and @tryit.sampling for my honest opinion.  

I am in love with this backpack.  I've taken it with me on every nature hike and all overnight stays.  It's super lightweight, so it doesn't bog you down on your hike.  It's honestly the most comfortable and easy to carry backpack I've used.  It has a flexible back frame that's cushioned with lots of ventilation, a cushioned hip strap with clasp to keep it in place, several other adjustable straps with clasps to keep your backpack stable and comfortable.  There is plenty of storage space in the main pouch.  And there is an array of mini pouches throughout.   This particular backpack is the women's fit, which entails a shorter back length, more narrow shoulder straps and the cushioned hip strap is curved for a closer fit.  They really put a lot of thought in when designing this model.  I am so impressed with the quality and features!  I highly recommend all female hikers this most comfortable Dueter Backpack.
review.name: Cadillac of backpacks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This backpack is super lightweight and has tons of storage room. With the hard backing material it will also keep your stuff from being smashed. The material is also breathable and doesnt make my back sweat as much. I love this backpack!
review.name: Super lightweight backpack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] At first I couldn’t believe how much this bag can actually fit. The material is so well made and comfortable. The secret compartment to store keys and cash or card, not easy for anyone to walk past and get my valuables. I liked that I could have a space for my water bottle as well. It is super lightweight and comfortable to carry.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was first drawn to this bag because I love the color and look of this bag. Now I love it because of how light it is and how comfortable it is to wear all day. The straps fit comfortably on my larger busted frame and are easy to adjust to my size. It has plenty of pockets to keep everything organized with the right enough room for my needs. I used this bag so far for day hikes and going to Lego land.
review.name: So light and comfortable

name: Speed Lite SL 23L Backpack - Women's

description: Buy the 7mesh Industries MK3 Cargo Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: MK3 Cargo Bib Short - Men's

hasVariant.name: MK3 Cargo Bib Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the 7mesh Industries MK3 Cargo Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I really like 7Mesh jackets and MTB gear, so I was hopeful for these. I tried them on only, did not ride in them. Fit was very good, a nice supportive feel and neither too loose nor too tight (I followed the fit chart). However, two things turned me off: 

First, the fabric is quite burly and somewhat rough, compared to any other bib I've tried. It's probably durable and tough and all that, but it definitely doesn't have a smooth next-to-skin feel that I generally prefer; it's almost scratchy.

Second, the chamois is actually attached to a separate piece of material that runs from belt line to belt line front-to-back, like a mesh loin cloth. This is honestly pretty odd, and not something I've ever seen in a high-end bib. It helps the whole rough fabric issue mentioned above, but it means there's extra material to bunch and prevent ventilation. 

Overall these seem like bibs designed by mountain bikers, and if you want something very burly and multi-layered maybe they're for you. I generally prefer bibs to fit like a second skin with minimal seams and material, and these definitely don't do that.
review.name: Couldn't love em

name: MK3 Cargo Bib Short - Men's

description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness KICKR Climb online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: KICKR Climb
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness KICKR Climb online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Can't tell you how great this is. I use it climbing on Zwift and you feel like you are on the road cruising through rollers. It is as close as you can get to riding outside being indoors.
review.name: Elevates Training

review.reviewBody: I love this product! It makes climbing the hills in Zwift so much more fun and even better, makes the downhills really cool (try the tube in London! or fly down after climbing up to the Radio Tower). I was able to set this up pretty easily, although I did check with a friend to make 100% certain. You need to remember to push the button every time you ride because the default is manual, that's a tad annoying but not too big a deal. Now I wish there was a way to add steering and I would be set. Worth the price? If you love gadgets and love riding, then sure. Necessary? Not at all, but now that I have it, I wouldn't want to ride indoors without it.
review.name: Imerssive Fun and very cool

review.reviewBody:
First, when the Climb arrived, it unfortunately did not work.  I was super bummed, because I was looking forward to using it right away.  I emailed Backcountry, and they sent me a return authorization and a new one before I even returned the bad one.  Great service.

Second, I love it.  I've been using it for about a month now.  On the flats it doesn't do much of course.  On hilly routes, it is more engaging and it feels more connected to the road.  I always found it weird when the Kickr increases/decreases the resistance to go up and down hills but the bike stayed the same.  Like mentally I could not process why it was getting harder or easier.  Last night I went up the Alpe with it for the first time, and it was awesome.  Both standing at 14% and seated at 8-10% feels much more realistic.  It would be even better if they can figure out how to use it with the new steering gizmo, but hopefully soon.
review.name: Great Service and Great Tool

review.reviewBody:
2020 - what a year, an Annus horribilis for the ages. I got out to the mountains exactly 0 times. I want to make up for that in 2021. Enter the KICKR Climb. 

When the grade goes up, your weight goes back onto your sit bones, and you engage your quads and hams as you would on a real climb. The simulated descents are useful too - you can work on powering through the stretches where you have not spun out your cassette.

This is a great training tool! And it just works. Really well.

NOTE: For free riding in Zwift you might want to set the trainer difficulty to 100% by default. Otherwise it kind of defeats the purpose.
review.name: Awesome training tool

review.reviewBody: It was working well but all of a sudden it started making loud clicking noises and is stuck in lowest setting.  It was only my third day using it!
review.name: Broke after only 3 rides on ZWIFT
comment: I would like to know as well what customer service you received from (most likely Wahoo)
Did CC or Wahoo replace it for you?

name: KICKR Climb

review.reviewBody: The tent is the perfect size for 2 people and my 80lb dog. Sets up easily and the vestibule area is perfect for drying off my dog and cleaning paws before getting into the tent

review.reviewBody: I typically use a 4 man tent for 2 man camping cause I love the extra space (Especially with my boyfriend being 6'4") and this tent is so roomy! It takes about 5 minutes to set it up. I love the vestibule which attaches really easy and only uses one extra pole. I put it on late and take it off early so I can look up at the sky through the mesh top. Definitely recommend this for 2-4 campers spring-fall! review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This cooler provides good insulation for transporting frozen or very perishable food item. But it lacks any support for an ice pack. This is very limiting, especially with food items that are not frozen and which would be harmed by contact with an ice pack.
I cannot imagine ever using the shoulder strap. Unfortunately, while the strap is easily removed, the large, bulky attachments are a permanent part of the bag.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have to bring all my food when I work 12 hour nights. We don’t get breaks it’s just 2 Nurses on. This cooker keeps everything perfectly cool. We can take a quick bite and put it back. It’s still cold the next time we open it. Awesome buy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband so happy with his vooler. He said good size and keeps his stuff cold.

review.reviewBody: I ordered for my husband to take to the office. He loves how it keeps his stuff cold. And has a lot of complaints on it too.

review.reviewBody: I’ve had cheap coolers form the grocery store work better than this. What am I paying for exactly other than the brand logo? I’ve melts quick, doesn’t seem to meet my expectations of hydroflask. I was very disappointed, I own twenty + hydroflask bottles and mugs and love them, was very bummed. Thinking I should have went with a yeti. Hoping I can get a refund or credit at the very least, this will not be used.
review.name: What am I paying for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome cooler, threw straight ice in there when I took it to the beach and it held up so well.
review.name: Awesome cooler, threw straight ice

hasVariant.name: Agility Sheath Dry Rope - 9.5mm
hasVariant.description: Buy the Trango Agility Sheath Dry Rope - 9.5mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is a great rope. I've had mind for about a year, I've been hard on it and it has held up great. It feels really solid, but it's also lightweight and smooth running. It's supple and easy to clip. 

Another reviewer mentioned twisting...? I haven't had that problem. It might be that when you buy a new rope, you need to unwrap it completely, don't just throw it in a pile out of the package.
review.name: Great rope, solid and nice feel

review.reviewBody:
I bought this rope on sale?.  

I?ve owned many ropes, I unwrapped this rope as you should?. Rolling it out.  And have struggled with twists/pig tails like crazy. 

I?ve stretched the rope out over a foot ball field in hopes to straighten it, even running through an ATC 10-15 times.  No matter what I do, it twists up on me. 

Middle marker rubbed off only after 4-5 climbs.

The sheathing/coating  is also an issue, it doesn?t feed through a grigri very well.  I strayed from Eledrid due to stock issues, don?t think I?ll ever purchase another Trango rope.

  I found myself taking my older ropes this weekend and leaving my new Trango at home. Bummer
review.name: Good Rope, but I can?t get it to untwist

name: Agility Sheath Dry Rope - 9.5mm

review.reviewBody:
Bought this instead of a hitch rack, to avoid the extra size. The constant contact of the bike with the tailgate dented my door. Now the cost of the pad plus the repairs will cost the same as a decent hitch rack. Go figure…. I suggest, buy a moving pad, pretty cheap at any hardware store, and use it as an additional layer of extra cushioning and paint protection. 
Keep on biking!!
review.name: Too thin of a pad

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit for a bike trip with the boys.
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody: I’ll be off the rocker a bit with this pad in regards to other reviews, but I feel it is severely lacking in padding and protection. Bought a new Ram PowerWagon…curved tailgate…this fits a curved tailgate slightly better than the Raceface I went with, however, the padding is a fraction the thickness. Especially where the bike stanchions touch the crease in the tailgate.  Maybe 1/4” padding on the entire outside to protect your tailgate/bike. Granted there are Velcro straps to hold the bike in place, as is the case with most pads, but it appears any impact from a mild dirt road would damage the stanchion and/or tailgate.  I can see it working ok with a flat tailgate, even though it still has far less protection than other pads.  I have always been a fan of Evoc products, but this falls short with regards to protection for both your expensive mtn bike and expensive truck. In comparison, the Raceface T2/T3 pad has a thick 1” section of padding in addition to the rest of the pad to protect the stanchion where it contacts the tailgate. Also, as a more minor complaint…the pad is a couple inches too long for the tailgate on a full size truck. Have to fold the edges in to close the tailgate. That was my experience anyway.
review.name: Evoc Tailgate Pad on Ram

review.reviewBody: This tail gate pad is excellent. Why bother with a 350$ pad?  The pad has a felt backer to protect your truck’s finish. The rubberized pads on top protect your frame. Installation is easy.
review.name: High Quality

review.reviewBody:
**Original Aug 2018**
I have a 2015 F-150 and the pad fits well enough. The tail gate is curved and the pad is straight and that causes the pad to  puckers a bit. But, the function of the pad is very nice. The blocs and straps secure the bikes nicely. The tailgate flap is large and tucks completely out of the way so you can use your camera.  The material is sturdy and is holding up well. This pad has less padding than others, but is more strategic about where it is used. I was looking at the RaceFace pad and it had much more padding everywhere. The upside of less padding is that the pad can be folded and stored much more easily. The Race Face could not be folded. the EVOC can go under the back seats in my truck.

**UPDATE Aug 2021**
After 3+ years of heavy use I still like the pad. It its on my tailgate from April to Nov and hauls bikes 3-4 days per week during that time. I park outside so the pad gets beat by the sun and I expect things to wear out. I had to replace the Velcro straps twice and some of the stitching broke along the top edge where it bends over the tailgate but I was able to glue it back together. I need to find a canvas shop to do the repair properly. I will nurse this along until it falls apart. I am pleased with this pad.
review.name: 3+ years and continues to impress

review.reviewBody: I have this on my 2019 ford ranger and it fits perfect. The pad does cover up the backup sensor but that is to be expected. Makes getting bikes in and out a breeze without having to worry about scratching up the bike or truck.
review.name: Perfect tailgate pad

review.reviewBody: After reading other reviews, I ordered the M/L size for my 2019 F-150 because it also has a rollback bed cover and I need it to size smaller than the width of tailgate. This size works very well for my pickup, although of course it does not extend all the way to bottom of the tailgate which I expected ordering the smaller size. The tailgate handle and camera flap lines up well. It does pucker some  due to the curve of the tailgate but I am ok with that. Overall, happy with the purchase and have left it attached to my pickup weeks on end so I can simply throw my mountain bike in and go on a whim.
review.name: Meets my needs

review.reviewBody: Great pad-works well and is easy to install. I really like the aluminum clips as opposed to plastic and the soft underside. Only reason it didn?t get a 5 star is because the tailgate opening doesn?t line up with the handle/backup camera. Not a huge issue but since they went through the trouble of making the opening........2020 Tacoma
review.name: Works well

name: Tailgate Pad

review.itemreviewed: Trail Code GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these as someone that plays a lot of disc golf and spends a lot of time in the woods. This holes are very cheap and do not hold up. I sent my first pair back after 3 months, only to get my second pair and them only last a month. The souls come unglued on the edges. They need to be a solid soul to last for a while. The shoes themselves are very comfortable they just don't last.
review.name: Not worth the money

review.itemreviewed: Trail Code GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I work for the post office and walk easily 9 miles a day. These have been a game changer and at the end of my shifts, my feet are never in pain. I do recommend sizing up at at least half a size to fit the normal length and they are slightly narrow so if you'd like a little bit of wet as well, you might want to go with a full-size.
review.name: Great for everyday walking

review.itemreviewed: Trail Code GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm still breaking them in while in the house but I can already tell that they are comfortable, fit well on my size 12 (sometimes wide) feet (these are a 12 regular), and absorb plenty of shock.
review.name: Comfortable.

review.itemreviewed: Trail Code GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I know that they are hiking shoes, but, they are great on concrete floors at 10 hours a day as well.
review.name: I will buy again

review.itemreviewed: Trail Code GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Trail Code GTX- After my ankle surgery and toe box on the Accuna just didn't work for me. So, I ordered the Trail Code GTX and some adjustment things are going good. Wearing them daily. Better fit.
review.name: 2nd Chance

review.itemreviewed: Trail Code GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The plastic on the heel was digging into my heel with every step. I returned the shoes.
review.name: Uncomfortable heel and fit.

review.itemreviewed: Trail Code GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: They are very comfortable and light. Feet feel great after using them.
review.name: Would definitely purchase again

review.itemreviewed: Trail Code GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought these in advance of a 3-day backpacking trip in the Sierras. Did not break them in in advance, they felt great and worked well, with good traction and support. Would recommend.
review.name: Really liked these

review.itemreviewed: Trail Code GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable shoe. If you are going to use it for everyday use then yes buy it. But for hiking do not they will fall apart. I had them for 3 weeks went on like 2 hikes and after that the sole was ripping off from the shoe. It's shameful that it is labeled a hiking shoe but the quality and durability was awful.
review.name: Don't buy

review.itemreviewed: Trail Code GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: It looks like this review won't allow me to post a Pic, but they arrived with noticeable creases in the toe area. I wore them 1 time and the creases got worse. I notified Hoka and their return and refund went very smooth.
review.name: Easy return process

name: Trail Code GTX Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I wore it again today.  Whenever I dont need a baclava I wear this. It may b with another thermal cap or if it's 35° to 55° I wear this solo.  I don't like that it sits 1/2 way down on my ears.  It should be above or down to cover the entire ear 👂.  It should b one or the other.  I usually wear it above and hav yet another item resting on my ears.  Sunglasses 😎 or goggles are enough I dont need other things resting on my ears.  I feels wierd and after  50 or so miles it starts to get irritating.  I like that its wind proof and its thin.  I did mod the brow area because I like (in cold weather) to have my skullcap riding on my eyebrows to cut out forehead freeze.  Most caps including this one  is round so to pull this down to my brows the sides tend to get into my eye sockets and mades it very hard to blink.  Sounds wierd but true.  None of this would be a problem if I didn't have thick gloves on so I could adjust everything.  But with gloves on what ever I put in before my ride stays in position or (in this cas) actually falls down to my eyes 👀.  The way I correct that is to get needle & thread and put one stitch in the skullcap just above the edge of my eyes to pull/keep the skullcap from riding down into my eyes 👀.  Its very simple and effective.  Why doesn't makers of skullcaps relize this and make the caps straight across tje forehead.  Believe me its more comfortable that way.  But…
review.name: A few minor adjustments and this is a pe

name: Neoshell Rain Beanie

review.reviewBody:
...no vents.  This was given to me as a gift.  I wore it on a chilly, breezy MTB ride one morning and had to shed it in less than a mile due to overheating and no way to vent.  Huge oversight on this product, IMO.  It does pack down nicely though.  

Keep in mind that Patagonia just recently delved into MTB gear; so, although it is nicely made, it's not made by mountain bikers for mountain bikers.

review.reviewBody: The North Face Men's Short-Sleeve Evolution Box Fit Tee is a perfect combination of style, comfort, and durability. From the moment I put it on, I could tell that this tee was designed for both everyday wear and active pursuits. The box fit provides a relaxed, modern silhouette that is roomy yet flattering, giving you plenty of freedom of movement without being too loose. The fabric is incredibly soft, with just the right amount of stretch to keep you comfortable throughout the day. It's also breathable and moisture-wicking, making it a great choice for outdoor activities like hiking, running, or training sessions. I've worn it for both casual outings and more strenuous workouts, and it performs excellently in all situations. The design is simple yet stylish, with the subtle North Face logo adding a touch of sporty elegance. Whether paired with shorts for a laid-back look or layered under a jacket for a more active outfit, this tee works well for a variety of occasions. I've also been impressed with its durability-the fabric hasn't shown any signs of wear, even after multiple washes. Overall, the North Face Men's Short-Sleeve Evolution Box Fit Tee is a versatile, high-performance tee that excels in both comfort and style. Whether you're hitting the trails or simply looking for a high-quality tee for everyday wear, this one checks all the boxes. Highly recommended!
review.name: A Relaxed Fit with Premium Comfort and Performance!

review.reviewBody: Northface t shirts are very good quality! They wash and wear very well! i want one of these in every color!
review.name: My recommendation to anyone would be to buy every color!

review.reviewBody: I highly recommend this shirt. It was a gift for my brother and he really liked the quality and the fabric. It was very comfortable and cool.
review.name: Yes

This one arrived and I was blown away at how big it was. I washed it in cold, and dried it with the other new shirts that it came with, whoa! It was still huge
review.name: The fit huge for folks that normally wear XL
